title: What is React?
details: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It makes it painless to create interactive UIs by managing state and rendering efficiently.

title: Why use React?
details: React allows you to build fast and modular applications using reusable components. It's maintained by Meta and has a strong ecosystem and community support.

title: How do you create a component?
details: Components can be created as JavaScript functions or classes that return JSX. Function components are now more common with the introduction of hooks.

title: What are hooks in React?
details: Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features in function components. Examples include useState, useEffect, useContext, etc.

title: How does the virtual DOM work?
details: The virtual DOM is a lightweight JavaScript representation of the real DOM. React updates the virtual DOM first, compares it to the previous version, and only updates what's changed in the real DOM.
